snippet: A rule change this season that makes the extra point a 33-yard kick has already had an impact as kickers have already missed 13 attempts and coaches are thinking more about the 2-point conversion.
abstract: Two-point conversions are being considered more often by NFL coaches now that kickers must attempt extra-point from 33-yard line instead of 20-yard line.

byline.contributor: Ben Shpigel and Matt Higgins contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A rule change this season that makes the extra point a 33-yard kick has already had an impact as kickers have already missed 13 attempts and coaches are thinking more about the 2-point conversion.

headline.main: With Longer Kicks, Extra Points Lose the Dullness of Dead Certainty
headline.print_headline: Extra Length and Interest for the Extra-Point Kick
